alert.note: Alert for Coastal Martin; Inland Martin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 9:54PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Martin County through 1045 PM EDT... At 954 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hobe Sound, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stuart, Jupiter Island, Hobe Sound, Port Salerno and Palm City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for east central Florida.
